moves.1. f4:
Hi everyone!

I have just read a thread on one of the general forums about the Bird's Opening.  This prompted me to annotate one of my mini-tournament games.  This one ended in a draw but what happened in between may be of interest.  So, white kicks off with 1. f4, this move characterises the Bird's Opening.
moves.5. O-O O-O 6. Nc3 c5: 6. ...... c5 - I make space for myself on the queenside - later on this is where the action will be.
moves.9. Qd2 Bb7 10. Ne5 e6 11. Rd1 Nc6: 11. ...... Nc6 - I get around to developing my queen knight and put a question to the knight on e5.  He exchanges.
moves.12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Bf3 Qc7: 13. ..... Qc7 - this move clears the decks and connects the rooks.  Can I do anything with this lead in development though?
moves.14. Qe2 Rfd8 15. Bd2 Rab8: 15. ....... Rab8 - a good idea to put a rook on a half open file I think.
moves.16. Rab1: 16. Rab1 - both rooks oppose each other.
moves.18... Rba8 19. Na2 a5 20. Nc3 Rdb8: 20. ........ Rdb8 - both black rooks make use of those open and half open lines.
moves.21. Qd3 Qb6 22. Be1 Qc7 23. e4: 23. e4 - this move triggers off a series of trades.
moves.23... dxe4 24. Nxe4 Bxe4 25. Bxe4 Nxe4 2: 26. ....... Qc5+ - a lot of wood has been cleared from the board over the last few moves.  Now Glenda makes her presence felt.
moves.27. Bf2 Qb4: 27. ....... Qb4 - offering a queen trade but white evades it.
moves.28. c4: 28. c4?! - not sure about this move though, it makes the b3 pawn backward and this pawn will net me half a point later on.
moves.28... Rbd8 29. Rdc1 Rab8 30. Rc2: 30. Rc2?! - I think this move helps to ensure the draw for me.  I now take advantage of the fact that the b3 pawn is pinned to the b1 rook.  I now have the opportunity of swapping off my a pawn isolani.
moves.30... a4 31. Be1: 31. Be1 - this move starts off a threefold repetition.
moves.31... Qc5+ 32. Bf2 Qb4: 32. ...... Qb4 - let's do this dance again!
moves.33. Be1 Qc5+: 33. ...... Qc5+ - this game occurred just before a change in the threefold repetition procedure.  Gameknot asked me whether I wanted the game drawn.  I clicked on the yes button because my opponent's rating was north of my own, so I was content with the draw game.
